snippet: The firms’ lawsuit argues that the Joint Commission on Public Ethics overstepped its mandate when it adopted new a rule on disclosing work for editorial columns.
abstract: Prominent public relations firms file suit in federal court against Joint Commission on Public Ethics, challenging advisory opinion that expanded group's definition of lobbying to include placement of editorials for clients; plaintiffs allege rule limits free speech.
lead_paragraph: The firms’ lawsuit argues that the Joint Commission on Public Ethics overstepped its mandate when it adopted new a rule on disclosing work for editorial columns.

headline.main: Public Relations Firms Sue New York Ethics Panel Over New Disclosure Rule
headline.print_headline: P.R. Groups Sue a Panel Over a Rule on Lobbying
